website_summaries.verdict: The $99.99 Plantronics Voyager Legend big boom microphone isn't for the fashion conscious but its superb call audio quality and comfortable fit make it an excellent buy.
pros: Lighter and less bulky than other boom-style headsets, the Plantronics Voyager Legend has superb audio quality and a well-crafted, comfortable design
cons: The Plantronics Voyager Legend's big boom mic arm isn't compact
Its ear tips don't form a tight audio seal

customer_reviews.title: Plantronics used to be good.
customer_reviews.text: I owned a few Voyager pro's in the last 10 years. Eventually they died after a couple of years or so and I replaced them with the same model. I really like how they fit. Unfortunately, In the past 3 months I have had 2 of the Voyager Legend's. One failed to keep connections with my phone. The second one the speaker failed after 5 weeks. Also the programmer forgot to leave a space after the the word "To" so when it responds it says, " Calling ToJohn Smith."
customer_reviews.author: jkhughes

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this brand for years with great satisfaction, but i cant say the same for this particular model unfortunately! keeps disconnecting for no reason from my Note 8, also if i have the headset in my right ear and the phone in my left pocket, i get tons of static like experience which is horrible! i tried updating the firmware and doesnt seem to correct any of the of the problems. i would not recommend this headset for anyone especially for having such a premium price!
customer_reviews.author: Freddy .G

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality isn't good
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this headset because I'm frequently on conference calls so I needed something with some noise cancellation. My previous employer had some high end Plantronics headsets that were great. This product isn't the same quality but it's also quite a bit cheaper. However, even given the price point I think the audio quality is still not up to par. It isn't super loud, the audio is tinny and then there are pops and crackles like you're listening to a record. Could I do it again, I'd probably go with something better but I'm out of my return period now so I'll live with it for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling Rose

customer_reviews.title: I have owned plantronics ear pieces for years...
customer_reviews.text: I have owned plantronics ear pieces for years... The quality is still the best in every arena but one: they now have a charging attachment previous models did not have. It is no longer possible to just plug it into a normal small end charger--you have to have this magnetic attachment between. The more compact magnet will not stay connected to the earpiece without masking tape; an all-in-one is also available, and works better, but has a cord 6" long. I do not know who the rocket scientist is who thought up this little, unnecessary addition, but perhaps they should consider a new career where they can make more devoted customers miserable.
customer_reviews.author: Me again.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I work outside. Battery lasts 7 hours or more. This is so light I forget I'm wearing it. The only thing I can say bad about it is that the piece that fits inside your ear just sits there so it doesn't block surrounding noise if it's loud. The people on the other end hear me fine 95% of the time and wind noise is the only complaint from them and that's only when it's 15 mph+. I highly recommend this and will buy another if ever needed.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Best Quality when paired to one phone at a time
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several of these now. That isn't a knock on the product. I spend a lot of time conducting field work, so any headset I own gets subjected to some pretty rough treatment, and more than a few have found themselves going through the laundry. It is a pretty decent bluetooth headset. I have found that for some reason the outgoing voice quality the other end receives is affected by having 2 phones paired at the same time. When the person I am talking to complains about my voice quality, I simply turn the bluetooth off on the second phone, and they report that they can hear me better. The noise cancellation is adequate for most purposes.
customer_reviews.author: KENISALL

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous at first. Sound quality degenerated over time. No charger!
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality of this headset was excellent at first, with a very long battery life. On very long drives it was useful for those 'help me overcome the boredom' conversations. The battery life is still good, but the sound quality deteriorated sharply. Now, even with a full charge, the people on my calls say they have trouble hearing me. This should be sold with a charger. Having to buy the separate charging container is annoying. Now I have two devices that don't fulfill the core requirement. Still good for listening to music while out and about, if you don't mind the single ear, but not so great for conversations.
customer_reviews.author: DMSReader

customer_reviews.title: Keep your charger handy!
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is okay Most people I am talking to, do not report any issues hearing me Fit is pretty poor for me. None of the exchangeable tips make the headset feel like it is going to on my head securely My large gripe is the battery. Talk time is okay, but it drains constantly whether it is on or not. If I use it for 30min one day, turn it off, and leave it overnight, it will be dead in the morning. Makes it fairly useless unless you can keep it on the charger constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Peter C.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well with a flip phone
customer_reviews.text: This product is difficult to review for the simple reason that it does NOT work well with a flip phone...which is NOT stated anywhere. I can only assume it will work with a smart phone. The problem with using this bluetooth product with a flip phone is that if you are on a call and get an incoming call it will automatically switch you over to the incoming call and many times disconnect the first call. I contacted the company about this and they couldn't figure out how to remedy the problem. They said to contact the seller of the flip phone. I did. They couldn't figure out how to solve the problem either.
customer_reviews.author: Truth Be Told

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working bad sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this particular brand and model for about 4 years now. The noise cancellation is great for my Diesel truck, the sound quality works great for about 1 year. I have noticed the last few I bought loose there sound quality after about 3-6 months of continuous use. I was a big supporter of this devise when it came out. I am not sure if its a change in manufacturing or quality control inspection. The price was originally $100, now you can finds them for around $50, I am wondering if the drop in quality is reflected by the cost change. I have about 10 of them in a drawer that don't work anymore.
customer_reviews.author: gfmonkey

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 5 months. Plantronics not friendly. Warranty painful
customer_reviews.text: You better hope you don't ever have to deal with Plantronics customer service agents. There were such issues communicating with them. They would say they understand but they do not. They are just reading a script of canned responses. My unit broke after 5 months of daily use. I'm trying to do a warranty claim, and will report back with an update, but it is such a pain, that I highly doubt anything will come of it. The product is fine while it works, but not worth the trouble if and when it breaks. I would try a competing company that better stands behind their products and customer satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: All_Too_Well

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well with glasses
customer_reviews.text: I simply could not fit the included earpiece in my ear. It came nowhere near my ear canal, no matter how I tried to position it. I couldn't say if the sound quality or the noise cancellation on these devices is worth the purchase, because I couldn't use them at all. After purchase and return, a friend told me there are "adapters" that are absolutely necessary for most people to purchase. So, Plantronics, how about you change the design so they fit MOST people, not sell adapters to help MOST people wear them. That's benefit to the producer, not benefit to the customer. End result = people buy and return resulting in lost revenue.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product for those with smaller ears
customer_reviews.text: Battery life could be longer and this is NOT the best purchase for those with smaller ears- I am a small person and granted, I have small ears as a result so getting a proper fit is nearly impossible. At best, it does its job but requires constant readjustment and no way would I use it while walking around or moving. Noise-cancellation is so/so but better than nothing. Sound is a bit tinny but perhaps that's because of the fit? It'll do in a pinch but if any of the above is important/critical purchase points for you, be aware of what you will get and the limitation of the product.
customer_reviews.author: DM Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works great, most of time
customer_reviews.text: So I love this, but not the greatest. Sound quality is great, noise cancelling is great - I have my music blaring in the background while on sales calls, and no one can hear it. There is a ton of crackling / breaking up while i'm on a call though if i'm faced a certain way at my desk, dont know if it's from power lines outside, but I feel like the old days where you had to play with the antenna on top of the house to get just the right reception. Also, the battery has never charged to 100%. so I turn it off and charge it during my lunch, it never lasts the entire work day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really?
customer_reviews.text: Plantronics, " first on the moon, last place on earth". I have used these for over 10 years, loved them!. The last two I have bought are absolute, bar none, POS! I will not buy another Plantronics anything.!!
customer_reviews.author: Donger

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and works well, needs higher volume
customer_reviews.text: Got this when Georgia law went hands free only. I'm in a Jeep with a soft top so needed something of higher quality. This works well most of the time, the only issue is the volume does not go up high enough. Works well in a regular vehicle, but in a Jeep with a soft top and traveling down the road it can't overcome the road noise. It's quality built and has good battery life too. I like that it works pretty seamlessly with my iPhone so I can use "talk to text" or voice dial. Overall a great headset, just not perfect for my specific needs.
customer_reviews.author: N. Edgar

customer_reviews.title: Best headset yet
customer_reviews.text: Wow is the easiest thing to say about this headset! I dont know how it has been out as long as it has and I haven't heard about it. I work around semis that are very loud and it cancels the noise like a champ. People on the other end never complain about to much back ground noise now! I have had a blue patriot and this beats that by a long shot!! The hardest thing is to get used to it in your ear and how to push it in. I got the charging/carting case and that is very handy.
customer_reviews.author: NOOT

customer_reviews.title: Was good while it worked!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased several similar products by this manufacturer over the past couple of years. The last product purchase in May 2019 will be the final one. Three months later and it stopped working! Tried calling the 800 number for assistance with this device and their automated service stated all representatives were busy then terminated the call. I attempted to access the web page and it says "not found". We're very disappointed in the product's short life-span. It was a great little device while it worked though.
customer_reviews.author: SEvy

customer_reviews.title: Battery not for full day use.  Volume and clarity also not the best
customer_reviews.text: Our batteries aren’t lasting a full day - were on the phone a lot. And the sound quality (volume and clarity) are not the best. Expected better from them. Due to battery well probably replace and based on experience will look at nonPlntronic sets first to be honest. They make great corded headsets; underwhelmed by their wireless. I would have rated lower, but the issue could also be due to phone unit, just can’t tell and since plantronics support is the non-existent support of faqs and knowledge bank, most of the blame is put on these. The phones have actual customer support through my voip provider and they’ve checked the phones multiple times now.
customer_reviews.author: Felix Joseph Bocanegra Jr

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality more 1999 than 2020.
customer_reviews.text: Meh. Poor noise cancellation. Tinny sound quality with callers immediately asking if I was in a car - when I was not. For a hundred bucks and voluminous rave reviews I thought this would be a workable unit. It is not. I need a device that sounds akin to using the handset. I had better quality from the mpow. P.s. I did enable the hd calling and update firmware.
customer_reviews.author: thisguy

customer_reviews.title: Not all that great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hoping it was a keeper, but after a few months I found more than a few issues with it. The sound isn't very loud at the loudest setting, and the noise cancellation is ok, not fantastic like my Blue Parrot. The one thing I dislike the most is the headset sometimes will not stay connected at times, it is intermittent. At first I thought it was my phone, but after purchasing a new one, found it wasn't the phone, it was the headset. I would not recommend anyone purchase this unless you really needed to.
customer_reviews.author: UsualSuspect

customer_reviews.title: does not work with Cisco technology
customer_reviews.text: Mine seemed ok for a few calls, but then people could not hear me. I tried to use Plantronics hub to update the device and it stopped working. Plantronics made me pay to return the item for a refurb replacement which was a newer model and worked even worse than the first one right out of the box. I have discovered from some experts that the reason this happens is Plantronics is not compatible with Cisco VOIP tech, and wont work for webex calls, jabber etc, despite being advertised as working with it. For Cisco, get jabra or a cheap brand and it will work.
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this headset
customer_reviews.text: I used this for years at my last job and am no longer with the company, so had to give it back to them. I liked the headset so much that I had to purchase my own, and this one is just as great as the original. Dual phone/PC capability is great, voice control, and call control from the headset. The main reason I like it, besides comfortable fit, is the noise cancellation. I drive a loud diesel with no muffler and I can still hold a phone call while driving down the highway with the windows open, and that is what sold me on this thing. 10/10 would buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Headset
customer_reviews.text: First review: Excellent product that doesn't have the features of much more expensive 5200, but it is every bit as good or better. Update review: July 17, 2017 - bought the device in December 2016 and it began to drop calls in early June. This behavior worsened and recently barely held a call for longer than a minute before dropping back to the iPhone. It was not the battery as it always registered at full charge and it was not the Bluetooth connectivity. Thus from a great review to a "meh." Bought a Firegram to replace it that was far more reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: MkLt

customer_reviews.title: dependable
customer_reviews.text: I've owned three of these now. The first one went swimming during a misadventure involving a trailer, a boat ramp, a rotisserie chicken, a seagull and a dog. The second one met its spectacular demise in a microwave with some chicken and a baked potato, and scared the bejesus out of the dog. (do not put this headset in the microwave, bad things happen, and the dog won't forgive you). Both performed well right up until chicken became a factor. I'm just going to keep this one at work, and away from chicken (and dogs). It connects quickly, it announces that it's connected, what it's connected to, and how much talk time (in hours) it has available on the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and works well
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd one of this headset (dogs are the 1st one). Mostly love it but occasionally it just stops connecting to the phone so I have to turn it off and back on. 1st one did the same thing. I do not lose calls and. it happens which is good. Just an annoyance. Only other complaint is sometimes I hear my voice echo back to me after I speak making it difficult to hear who I'm talking to. It does not happen all the time and there seems to be no rhyme or reason for it. Other wise, I really love the headset, ease of use and compact design.
customer_reviews.author: Lbuck

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: I have used Plantronics headsets for the last several years as my son, a former country music Techie, recommended it. I love the ease of operating it while driving. It is fairly comfortable for my strangely shaped ears...(I cannot use most earbuds including the ones that come with my I Phone !). The sound is terrific. According to a recent review, it rated 1 of the top 10 according to experts as well as customers. I wore my last one out, breaking the twist able arm, so I reordered and am pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Sue Farris

customer_reviews.title: Love everything about this headset!!!
customer_reviews.text: This headset is phenomenal! Very comfortable to wear for long periods of time, has great sound quality, and easy to use headset buttons/adjustments. It holds a great charge and is also a very nice size- small enough to be extremely compact and large enough to easily pick up to place on ear. Definitely worth the price! I bought the traveling case for it as well and am very pleased with the combo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality from the start!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome quality! It’s comfortable enough to wear all day. Many times I forget I have it on until I get a phone call. If my hands are full and I can’t take a call, I simply say “ignore” and continue on my way. I don’t have to stop to accept or cancel anything. Totally voice controlled! Over the years I have owned several Plantronics Voyager Bluetooth Headsets and have been pleased with all of them, but this one has the best noise cancellation of them all. I’m a fan for life!
customer_reviews.author: J Scott

customer_reviews.title: Good quality sound
customer_reviews.text: Good quality sound, no complaints with regard to others hearing me and the battery has been great so far. It verbally tells you how much talk time you have left each time you turn it on so that is very helpful. My only complaints: I have yet to get the verbal commands to work as far as calling someone after pressing the button. The fit is somewhat awkward and I keep feeling like it is going to fall off. I am not sure it would stay on while doing laundry or other household chores that require bending. It fits most of my needs so I opted to keep it, especially for the sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Gennifer

customer_reviews.title: Knock-off Headset that is NOT Plantronics
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Plantronics Voyager Legend, and this is the third one I've had (due to losing the others). The other ones were new headsets from Plantronics, and this one is used and doesn't seem to have the same features as the other ones I've had. The headset is comfortable and sounds okay, though it is missing pieces and doesn't have voice recognition like the Plantronics Voyager Legend typically has. What I received seems to be a knock-off of the original headset. I'd give the actual headset 5 stars, but this knock-off is barely worth 2.
customer_reviews.author: mts

customer_reviews.title: truck driver, excellent for noise cancelling!!
customer_reviews.text: this bluetooth is awesome!!!! only complaint is the part that goes in your ears, its bulky so i always have to use a headband to secure it so i can hear properly. i think they sell an attachment, or something you can put on it to make it better. Ive made calls to a different few countries and everyone always thought i was resting in my room because it was so quiet, NO background noise whatsoever!!!! But I was driving a super extra noisy Mack truck!!!! It's a win for me!!!
customer_reviews.author: Maila Serda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality excellent sound
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one first one died after about seven years and the battery is not replaceable but up until that time it was still working perfectly. I was able to buy a holster that Clips on my belt for it and it always is right at hand and available. Sound quality and comfort is excellent the speaker sits on top of your ear canal not in your ear canal which I like as the ones that go in the air tend to get uncomfortable quickly. There are less expensive Alternatives even half price but given the performance and quality of the Plantronics and their reputation I didn't even want to take the chance.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: It works fine with the phone
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving 5 stars because it works fine for what I bought it, to make phone calls. It works great with regular phone calls and with apps like GoToMeeting, Zoom, and others as well. It doesn't work well with the computer. I already tried 2 computers and for some reason I'm not able to determine yet, the sound is really crapy, it will be very good to be able to use it with the computer, but I have one for tat porpuse, so it doesn't bother me, but take it in consideratio when buying
customer_reviews.author: Roberto

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancellation cancels your voice too, cannot turn off
customer_reviews.text: It took a couple months (heard that is common) but people started telling me my audio volume was fading in and out. After some research online, it sounds like the noise cancellation mics get confused and think me talking is background noise, and cancels me out! Installed the software but there's no way to shut off noise cancellation on this model (I'm in a quiet room, I don't need it). Going to try taping over what I think are the ambient mic holes, and if that doesn't work these are a total waste.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Nelson

customer_reviews.title: What happened to the good old reliable products that I loved?
customer_reviews.text: I owned many Plantrinics headset but am disappointed at this one. Constantly redialing the last number, even with voice commands and sensitivity turned off, had to turn the unit off. Mic is inconsistent (people can't hear me clearly most of the time. It was under warranty so Plantrinics sent me a replacement (refurbished), worked until warranty expired tgen turns itself off as soon as it was turned on. What happened to the good old reliable products that I loved?
customer_reviews.author: H Tai` Truong

customer_reviews.title: I received a bad one
customer_reviews.text: I think I received a bad one. I have used this in the past with no issues (same model). The person I am talking to sometimes can’t hear me, but I hear the other person just fine. I can try and adjust the mic closer to my face, but same issue. I actually ended up returning this one. Likely just a defective one I received. I ended up buying AirPods, the noise cancelling on the AirPods are not comparable to how great the noise canceling feature on this plantronics headset is.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Voice and audio fine. The width of ear piece makes it cumbersome behind the ear. Charger is a joke. The ear piece and charger connect by magnets which do not hold securely or charge dependably The cord is maybe 6" long, which means trying to find a flat surface that is close to AC to set the ear piece on. Since the magnets won't hold a dangling ear piece weight. Not great for traveling. I've used Plantronics for many year's. I expected this this ear piece to be great. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tash

customer_reviews.title: Overall this works really nice, but there are some issues that annoy me
customer_reviews.text: Overall this works really nice, but there are some issues that annoy me, like having issues with getting it to connect to my Windows phone at times, especially if I use my wireless audio earphones. The work around is having to delete the headset in the bluetooth settings, then sync the headset so the phone can find it. I would like to know if this due to my Windows phone or if others have the same issue with switching back and forth from the headset to earphones. Also if others have this issue with using other brands of bluetooth headsets and earphones. My earphones are Jaybird X2's.
customer_reviews.author: Sherman Buck

customer_reviews.title: This item is being falsely advertised as brand new, it is refurbished and not in original packaging.
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed when I received this item and it was not in its original packaging. I feel as though I have either received a used or refurbished unit. I have bought these brand new before and this was not new packaging or original charging unit either. The volume of the earpiece is not as loud as the other one that I had before either. I feel as though this was totally misleading and seller fraud. When I received this it came in packaging as though it was a refurbished cell phone.
customer_reviews.author: R. Crook

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality
customer_reviews.text: I use this for work mostly, it sounds awesome feels comfortable you forget you got it in your ear. This is the only brand that I ever buy nothing else, they last for a about a year and half to two years before they get kinda loose and they will break along the bend. But after that you can still glued it and use it for a while more but I usually just buy another one they’re affordable enough to just do that. But I highly recommended them.
customer_reviews.author: Carcrz

customer_reviews.title: This is probably Plantronics best model.......
customer_reviews.text: Seems most people have this mode and I see why. Clear sound, incoming caller notification, quick charge (est.30min for a 7hr/talk time - charge from any office/home outlet. Estimated 1-1.5hr via car/cigarette lighter). It's durable, non irritating around the ear, noise cancelling and the volume is pretty loud. (P.S. I get my ears cleaned as part of my physical check ups) Nevertheless, I'm 2yrs in now with this model on my Android and no problems yet. Beware of the copy cat models out there. Make sure it's "Plantronics".....Peace
customer_reviews.author: Kevin2

customer_reviews.title: Talk time....
customer_reviews.text: After I charge my headset it chimes off say, "Talk time 6 hours, phone one connected." After an hour on the phone it chimes, "Talk time less than 2 hours...". Thirty minutes later.... "Recharge headset". I believe there is a fundamental law of physics about time and space that should cover this, right? This is my 3rd headset and the only reason I put up with the poor battery life is because they are cheap enough and sound pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and stable
customer_reviews.text: It works just the way expected. I have trouble getting many of the headsets that I've used to stay put, and some of the ones that do become uncomfortable during long phone calls. The Voyager Legend fit comfortably on my ear and stays put. I haven't really stressed its abilities to cancel wind noise yet, but I've been happy with its performance. I really like the ability to pair with two phones. I tested this by pairing it with both my phone and with a Windows laptop. That convinced me that it actually works with two devices, but also reminded me how poorly Windows (and Windows applications) works with BT headsets.
customer_reviews.author: GregT

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Sound Quality and Well Made
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is very good - on both ends of the telephone call. The charge on the battery has been lasting approximately five (5) hours and it charges to full capacity in about thirty (30) minutes. If the device is left off for a period of time it seems to hold it's charge well. The longest I've worn it without taking it off is three (3) hours and it is comfortable for that period of time. It is designed to be worn in either ear. The mute, on/off, and volume button are easy to find and easy to use. I would recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: Where's Godot?Top Contributor: Classic Rock

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and perfectly designed
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth Plantronics headset and definitely the best yet. While it is generally very durable, my last one did not survive being run over by a lawnmower...This headset may not be the coolest looking one you can find, but it is the most functional. It is perfectly comfortable to wear all day long. The calls are consistently clear and the volume is sufficient. The noise cancelling works well too. Folks on the other end of the line can't tell I'm using my cell phone because of its clarity even when I am in my car. You won't regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: rhall37735

customer_reviews.title: Great investment and comfort
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this headset about 6 months ago. In the time I have owned it I have dropped it in water, dropped it off a roof, and flat out stepped on it. It has held up nicely in the hvac field with at least 6 hours of wear 5 days a week. The only complaint I have is the charging method, the headset has a magnet by the charging port and a small divot where the charger attaches, this magnets attracts very fine metal particles that clog the divot causing your charger to not make connections. Once a week I have to use high pressure nitrogen to clear the port just so I can charge it
customer_reviews.author: ToeTruck

customer_reviews.title: PLT Legend works great
customer_reviews.text: Plantronics Voyager Legend (PLT_Legend) Wireless Bluetooth Headset has been working great Things that you learn to work with o blue tooth distance between the PLT_Legend and iPhone or Win 10 laptop is limited due walls etc., iPhone workaround, take the phone with you o talk time is about 7 hours, so watch out for music on hold o practice with the PLT_Legend controls, such as mute and answer a second call, etc. before you need to use them in a live environment
customer_reviews.author: P. L. Arnett

customer_reviews.title: Are you Kidding,  A 6 inch custom Cable to charge it with...  Common folks this is absured!
customer_reviews.text: You Have To Be Kidding Me! The cable with the Special connector from the power plug is only about 6 inches... How Crazy is that... how the heck does anyone work with a 6" cable... Now I have to go spend another $10 to buy a longer cable with the special connector... What every happened to the ability to use the same cable that my phone uses.... I have tons of the laying around... Someone at Plantronics should be fired! This is crazy!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Kirkey

customer_reviews.title: Not Muffled
customer_reviews.text: You sound like you're on a real phone with the caller. It doesn't have an echo or anything. Spend the money for this. I tried a cheaper one before breaking down and getting this. The cheaper one made it sound like you were talking to someone through a tunnel. It was awful. This one is great, easily paired, easy to charge, light and comfortable in your ear. I've walked out of the office, forgetting it was still in my ear.
customer_reviews.author: pattyoryan

customer_reviews.title: Great, sleek design...wish it would work!
customer_reviews.text: The headset is a nice, sleek design and fits very comfortably. The headset does work fine for incoming calls, announcing the caller and asking whether to accept or ignore the call. However, the voice commands do not work for making outgoing calls. Still necessary to look at, and dial, the phone. I have an Android, a Samsung Galaxy S7. Not sure if the headset is defective, or not compatible with the phone, or if additional set up is required. It also sometimes allows the voice to become distorted, making it difficult to understand. Overall, a nice headset. If it worked fully, I would rate it much higher.
customer_reviews.author: TFish

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product!! Sound to hear is excellent and cancels out all background noise to the callers
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my handicapped sister who can't hold a phone up to her ear. The ease that someone else can put this on her ear is fantastic and it cancels out all the background noise so when talking to her, there is no distracting noise. She says she can hear so clearly! This was such an amazing answer for a problem that seemed hopeless for a very long time!!! This should product should market to the handicapped population as it really is a miracle for those that have difficulty physically!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Vander Ark

customer_reviews.title: Still the best for this style, but pricey
customer_reviews.text: This would be a 5 if not for the price. I have tried several less expensive options, but I reluctantly went back to the Legend, as none of the others work as well. Some complain about bulkiness, but I sometimes forget it's even ON. I had one of these some years ago. When the battery life faded (only good for a couple hours), I went experimenting. The Plantronics Pro is okay, but noticeable poorer for sound quality and battery life (and only pairs one device). The Legend is the way to go. The cheaper knockoffs save now, but you will pay later.
customer_reviews.author: Weary Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to include the charging case in your purchase calculations.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the voyager line for years, and other than some build quality issues on the earpiece pivots, I've had no complaints. The Legend keeps the same sound quality, but the magnetic charging cable is awful. Unless the device is plugged in and lain down just so, chances are good that the weight of the headset itself is going to shift the connector out of alignment and cut off the charge. Naturally, the charging case that would address this problem is sold separately.
customer_reviews.author: Ciro

customer_reviews.title: These are huge!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know about battery life, haven't used them long enough. These are something that you will want to wear all day because I found that they are clumsy to don and doff, but once on they are comfortable. Then there is the sound volume, or lack thereof. It was necessary to turn up phone media volume all the way as well as the headset volume all the way just to get a light "medium" volume in a quiet setting. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Rooks

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw
customer_reviews.text: This Bluetooth is good when it comes to sound and noise cancellation. But it could be better when it comes the battery life. The most concerning thing that bothers me the most is the curve that holds the device on poor. It often falls off and I have to adjust it a lot because it keeps slipping. So, often I will stop using it because it get frustrating to have to keep adjusting it. Currently looking for another device for hands free calls
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: They work great.  Noise reduction is AWESOME for your listener
customer_reviews.text: I have had 3 or 4 of these now over the last few years and they work great. Noise reduction is AWESOME for your listener. But don't be smashing any brown paper bags or hamburger wrappers lol because apparently THAT is VERY loud on the other end for some reason. But you can be in a LOUD restaurant or airport etc. and your listener hears nothing!! which is awesome. I also have a hard time hearing myself, well understanding what I hear I should say, and this headset helps with that tremendously!!! Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: No925r

customer_reviews.title: It's so comfortable that once I put it on in the morning
customer_reviews.text: Been using for years, exactly as described and arrived on time. It's so comfortable that once I put it on in the morning, I forget it's there. It has several benefits: 1 - the phone rings in this ear piece so I don't disturb people around me 2 - if the person calling is in your contact/address book, it tells you who's calling and you can give a verbal command to answer or reject 3 - THE MOST VALUABLE FEATURE to me is that when you walk too far away from your phone, it tells you it's disconnecting which has saved me from leaving my phone behind many times.
customer_reviews.author: Lesliethek

customer_reviews.title: Best Bluetooth headset I’ve used!
customer_reviews.text: The fit, interface, and sound quality of this headset is the best I’ve used. I have gone through probably 6 or so in the past and I would recommend this one to anyone without hesitation. My single complaint is the max volume could be a bit louder, but I’m mildly hard of hearing so I’m sure most people wouldn’t even notice.
customer_reviews.author: Atticus

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Use USB MIcro Chayrger
customer_reviews.text: I was replacing an older model Plantronics bluetooth (same type) that used a standard USB Micro Charger (the kind everyone has 10 of laying around. On this model, Plantronics tried to pretend it's Apple and used a unique charger, so instead of being able to carry a spare charger in your car, briefcase etc to make sure you're never without one, you only have the 1 that comes in the box. I will throw out this Bluetooth before I buy another charger from Plantronics, and will never buy another Plantronics bluetooth. This change wasn't for the customer, it was for Plantronics.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great device!
customer_reviews.text: This is unfortunately my third Voyager Legend because I have managed to misplace my previous two. I am VERY happy I can still find this model bluetooth headset. Battery life is great. Seven hours on full charge. Sound quality is the best I have had in a headset. While driving in the car the person on the other end do not realize I am in the car and often comment how great the sound quality is for a headset in the car. I tried the Plantronics around the neck headset and returned it recently and bought this Legend again. No comparison. The Voyager Legend is the best bluetooth headset on the market.
customer_reviews.author: EAP

customer_reviews.title: Best Voyager ever, and perhaps the best headset on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my third Voyager, and this version if far superior to the previous. Six hours of talk time, super fast charging, clear audio and super comfortable. My previous Voyager lasted about 5 years and I loved it. It's hard to believe they could make it better, but they did. If the phone is ringing, just turn it on and it answers. If it is on, you can answer calls by saying "answer" - or "ignore" if you want to ignore. Great if you have your hands full. Yeah, just get it. You can thank me later.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Elliott

customer_reviews.title: By far the very best headset I have used
customer_reviews.text: By far the very best headset I have used. It paired easily with an iPhone and a Samsung Galaxy. It is comfortable to wear with eyeglasses. This surprised me because I had never had an over the ear headset that was comfortable wearing glasses and this one truly is. The best part is both the sound volume and quality at my end and the sound quality for people at the other end. A friend remarked yesterday that she didn't even realize I was in my car or on a headset. She has always complained about the poor sound quality of past headsets. This one she said was crystal clear with nearly no background noise getting through.
customer_reviews.author: Kar Dell

customer_reviews.title: Not happy.
customer_reviews.text: The headset itself was fine, but the charger didn't work from the moment I received it. Not happy at all. The charger is a really bad design. I tried actually holding the headset against the charger to see if it was a bad connection, but the thing never worked. I've had a similar one that I used for work , so I know what I'm doing.
customer_reviews.author: Quilly

customer_reviews.title: I sound "tinny" or in a tunnel to others. But I hear everything well
customer_reviews.text: I had given my Motorola earbud (BT 3.0) to my father and decided to "upgrade" to Plantronics, and after long and hard search, found this model as a good value. However, I find it is not a good value, especially compared to the cheaper Motorola that I previously had (and my father still uses). I had used Plantronics since 2003 for my wired handless sets, and was always pleased. But this one is only good for listening to podcasts (wirelessly), not for phone calls :-(
customer_reviews.author: David Jackemeyer

customer_reviews.title: One of my most favorite headsets
customer_reviews.text: This has been one of my favorite bluetooth devices. Great sound quality. It is really great in every way except two The "battery" area is large and while it is very comfortable behind the ear, it prevents glasses/sunglasses from sitting where they normally do. The other "fault" is the charger. It is a proprietary charger that attaches to the headset with a weak magnet. The cord is really short so setting it somewhere in a car to charge is a real issue as it will inevitably disconnect.
customer_reviews.author: MartyJoe

customer_reviews.title: Voice Quality & Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: This is my second, so I am posting based on my original purchase. The background noise cancelling works wonderfully and it picks up my voice perfectly. I have owned other headsets which just cannot compete with the ability of this headset to pick up my voice. I purchased the first Legend in 2014 and when the original started having problems picking up my voice I needed to replace it. I did find videos on how to replace parts inside the boom but decided to purchase new headset and because of the battery life and the voice quality, I decided to purchase a new Legend. I expect this one to be a great as my first.
customer_reviews.author: J. O'Dell

customer_reviews.title: Plantronics Voyager Legend Wireless Bluetooth Headset Review
customer_reviews.text: Hello, My name is Chris. I am someone whose a disabled wheelchair user, and I have been using the Plantronics wireless bluetooth headsets for about the last10 years. I rely on using my wireless bluetooth for ease of making and receiving phone calls throughout my day. I have found the Plantronics Voyager Legend over the ear wireless bluetooth earpieces have gotten better and better as time goes forward. For someone looking to get their 1st Plantronrics product I highly recommend the Plantronics Voyager Legend for it's superb clarity, and long 7 hours of talk time. You won't be disappointed!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cruzzro

customer_reviews.title: Don't get one - buy 2
customer_reviews.text: Okay so buy 2 because you may lose one, I placed mine in the pocket with my keys and out it flopped on the ground - who knows where. As far as the product goes this one is pretty good as far as blue tooth's go for the phone. The plus inter changeable ears and ear socket protection and comfort. Down side well sometimes the noise cancellation isn't the greatest especially in the wind... but then again what is.
customer_reviews.author: David B Fretz

customer_reviews.title: It is a great headset, but better to buy it directly.
customer_reviews.text: I love this headset. I had one at a previous job that was supplied to me directly from the Plantronics company and it was amazing. This one is very similar, but it does have audio glitches from time to time. I would recommend buying it from the Plantronics site directly, but this one is perfectly adequate. Also, if you purchase this you absolutely MUST get the matching charging case. Trust me on that one, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Loveless

customer_reviews.title: Watch out  these are not NEW - they are pre-owned - certified refurbs
customer_reviews.text: Watch out these are not NEW - they are pre-owned - certified refurbs
customer_reviews.author: Larry Meadows

customer_reviews.title: No voice calls
customer_reviews.text: I had the Voyager Pro for five years and gave it a good review, not this one. I use a wireless earpiece so I can make and receive calls while driving. This unit can't do voice dialing. Samsung phones aren't too good at voice dialing but at least the predecessor could do it. Non of the other reviews mentions this. I guess I'm the only one who likes voice dialing. There is a proprietary magnetic plug. It could be seen as an improvement except for its incompatibility with all your existing plugs. A big down for me. The oddball plug isn't mentioned in the description. Their more expensive unit uses micro USB. I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K

customer_reviews.title: BEST Headset EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have been through 5 or 6 headsets in the last year trying to find one that will meet our needs and stand up to the task... Thank goodness for Plantronics!!! This headset is worth every penny! I bought this for my uncle who is always on the go and has to be on the phone constantly; this is the only headset that has had nothing but positive remarks from him (He wanted to call me at 6am to tell me how excited he was by the awesomeness of his new headset)! :D
customer_reviews.author: Dan & Sam

customer_reviews.title: Not for Win10 Surface Pro...ok for iphone
customer_reviews.text: This Bluetooth headset and mic does not work with my Windows 10 Surface Pro. It keeps disconnecting and interfering with my bluetooth keyboard and mouse. When it is connected, I cannot hear anything from the ear piece but the mic works according to the party on the other end of a skype call or a google hangouts call. The 2 stars is because it pairs just fine and stays connected with my iphone 7. The sound coming from the ear piece is tinny but I only use it for calls not as a headphone replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Lim

customer_reviews.title: This device hasnt worked since i received it
customer_reviews.text: This device did not work and everyone i spoke to while using it said it was breaking up and making bad connection noises. I wish i could return this but its too late now. I simply didnt use it for the last 3 months
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne

customer_reviews.title: Rated #1
customer_reviews.text: Wife would complain about the sound quality of my old $14 Bluetooth. Got this Plantronics model because more than a couple websites rated this model as the best. Guess you get what you pay for. Wife has moved on to other things to complain about.
customer_reviews.author: Runamoc

customer_reviews.title: These work well - clear sound
customer_reviews.text: These sound much clearer than some of the cheaper ones. Less static. So far, very pleased. Convenient to keep hands free when cooking, etc. Clearer in car for me than the built in on dash one that sound far away. My husband and i each have one and use them all the time. I washed my first one and it it did not survive. Just bought his parents each one for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good price. Delivered quickly. Decent noise cancellation. Version received was a plain package version intended to be used when large companies buy lots of them for their call center employees, etc. very, very short USB recharging interface cable with a nonstandard magnetic attachment to the ear set. Worked fine until someone stole it at a restaurant. Yes, I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Masamitsu

customer_reviews.title: Like it better than the Voyager Pro HD
customer_reviews.text: Long time user of Voyager bluetooth units. This one is by far the best for the following reasons: 1. Range is much more usable - I can put my phone in any pocket and still listen to an audio book without cut outs. Couldn't do that with the Voyager Pro or Voyager Pro HD. 2. More listening and talk time that previous models 3. Sliding switches for on an off are much easier to use than press and hold on previous models 4. Announces who is calling There are other feature improvements but the above are the ones important to me.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Stnschndr

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last 3 months!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bluetooth because i am constantly talking on the phone all day every day and not even 3 months later, anytime I use it i get told i sound like I'm in a fish bowl or they can't hear me... i get told i sound far away. No matter how much i move or fix my bluetooth i still get told i can't be heard. I'm very disappointed i thought this product would last and be much better. For the price i definitely expected it to last me more than 2 months and a half!
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: This is my third one
customer_reviews.text: This is my third one... of these. At first I thought it was me but now I realize there is default with the product. The earbud keeps falling off and getting lost. I know it turns and you can pull it off. When I am not wearing my ear piece, I keep it in my pocket or on my desk. The product is easy to use but once the ear bud falls off, it's no longer good. Disappointed.....other then supergluing the ear bud in, not sure what else I could have done. Sorry I bought the third one ...any suggestions out there for a better made product?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mistake
customer_reviews.text: Got for job interview web call, and I should have gotten literally any other microphone. The packaging was free of frustration, but it stopped there. The software install on Mac is under some developer's name, not the company. You have to bypass security to install it. The software is not stable, but you only need it for changing settings. The worst thing is call quality, the sound distorts and people have to ask me to repeat.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Hull

customer_reviews.title: I expected more from Plantronics
customer_reviews.text: I have a Plantronics headset at the office (landline) that works AWESOME! I was expecting the same out of this headset for my cell. Unfortunately it fails in comparison. CONS: The Bluetooth connection between this and my phone (Samsung S6) is poor. They have to be within 3' of each other. Also, if the phone is in my pocket while walking or sitting down, the reception goes in and out. This thing stinks! PROS: It fits nice, the call clarity is nice (when the above conditions are met). If I didn't know better, I would think that I got some cheap knock-off, not a real Plantronics.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: keeps fallling off my ear
customer_reviews.text: The part that fits over your ear is rather thick and heavy and it keeps falling off my ear, no matter how well I tuck my ear into it. I loved my previous plantronics headset; it fit perfectly and lasted forever. Not so happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Woofman

customer_reviews.title: Operates great but earpiece is a problem
customer_reviews.text: I like the performance of this device. It connects consistently and rapidly and has a nice voice recognition feature. It interoperates well with my iPhone. However the earpiece is a problem for me; none of the inserts shipped with the device fit my ear and as a result it is constantly dropping away making me fuss with it all the time. Because of the poor capture with my ear I have to turn the volume up all the way and even then often I can't hear it well. It would be perfect if it just fit in my ear.
customer_reviews.author: L Record

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy!!
customer_reviews.text: I am glad that I purchased this item. The should quality is awesome and I love using it when I am on a phone conversation so I don't have to hold my phone to my ear. Well made and easy to attach to your Bluetooth. Would recommend to all.
customer_reviews.author: Ami

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should.  Proprietary charger restricts charging options.
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should. Proprietary charger restricts charging options. You have to use the charger supplied so if you loose forget or break it your screwed. Most use standard micro USB chargers.
customer_reviews.author: James F.

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I like this headset because it announces caller names and you can answer your phone hands free by saying outloud "answer" or decline. There is a sufficient amount of noise cancellation and as an added bonus you can flip the microphone up away from your mouth if you need to cough or talk to someone in the background. You can also mute the phone with a little button on the headset. I've ordered this product twice in the last 5-7 yrs. I lost the first one and I broke the plastic attachment that is included for comfort. Even though I can't attach the plastic pieces the headset still works perfectly fine. Would probably order again
customer_reviews.author: FIYA KAT

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for work. I have never had great luck with Bluetooth headsets, but this one is amazing! It works extremely well, and has far surpassed my expectations. The only downside, and something I wished I had know prior to purchase, is that the battery life is only 7 hours on a full charge. I have an 8-hour job, so I have to find ways to stretch out the usage during the day.
customer_reviews.author: Scarecrow

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I just got it today, but with the short time I've had to use it - I love it. I had to keep reaching for it because it felt like it wasn't on my ear, it fits so well. Sound was between good and very good. The only complaint I have is the delivery. The delivery comment was "Your package was delivered. It was handed directly to a resident." Well, I rushed home because I had no idea who it was delivered to. Got home and it was on my front porch. Other than that, I love the device.
customer_reviews.author: D B

customer_reviews.title: It outperforms my expectations as to sound and range
customer_reviews.text: I have to say this wireless bluetooth earphones are a must for every driver. The sound quality is HD., real HD. Outstanding performance, excellent range, excellent sound quality when used just to make and receive calls. They are not designed to listen to music, so, if you're expecting a high quality device for listening to music, this is not the right one. But if you're looking for a earphone that amazes you with the quality of calls, this is the one. And the person you're talking on the phone with say they can hear as clear as water.
customer_reviews.author: jr2012

customer_reviews.title: I regret not listening to the bad reviews
customer_reviews.text: I highly regret not listening to the bad reviews. Initially, my headset was great, but after a few uses I started noticing a static noise when I would make calls. This now happens almost every time I use it. I rarely write bad reviews on amazon but it upsets me that problems with this have appeared so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality flucuates with how well it fits and stays in place
customer_reviews.text: I just missed the return deadline, or I would have returned this headset. It doesn't fit well enough (in my ears, anyway) to stay in place, and the sound quality is diminished greatly if it's not just right. I use it when I'm active, and sweating causes it to slip and feel uncomfortable. I've tried every different size ear piece but haven't found a really good fit.
customer_reviews.author: patmatt56

customer_reviews.title: Great Bluetooth headset but the adaptor is not common
customer_reviews.text: Great Bluetooth headset I like how it does not receive audio when I put it flat on the table for charging. I hate it when I want to watch youtube and the audio goes to my old Bluetooth. but the adapter is not common I struggle in the office if it runs out of battery. Rarely because its 7 hours talk time but sometimes I still drain them when I listen to music
customer_reviews.author: Junix

customer_reviews.title: Mute signal
customer_reviews.text: I'm prone to using this for calls in noisy environments (airports etc) and the mute function is very important. It's convenient enough but I would much prefer to get a fairly frequent signal that I'm on mute. This delivers an audio prompt when you go on and off mute and only signals mute status every 15 minutes or so. I think a simple little beep every 30 seconds would be preferable. Otherwise I'm so happy to be liberated from cables and adapters (new iPhone) that I am really glad to have gotten a bluetooth earpiece.
customer_reviews.author: aahann

customer_reviews.title: Not a bit impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Product didn't work nearly as well as described (and I expected for the price - have had cheaper ones that worked better), in particularly, the voice activated calling feature - a high percentage of the time it would call the wrong person, try to initiate 'facetime' with someone or just not call anyone (despite repeated commands to do so!). In additional not very loud (at all) difficult to hear someone talking (to you) unless you have excellent hearing and in perfect (quiet) conditions. The ear piece didn't fit into my ear well and the foam covers for it repeatedly fall off and are lost. Went through 5 or 6 of them before giving up on them altogether.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: It connects and discounts randomly
customer_reviews.text: The Bluetooth disconnects from the phone and reconnected by itself. So I can be talking on the phone and it just goes in and out. It's very aggravating especially when I'm on important calls. Overall the battery life is good for me the 7 hours and the sound is better then the one I had before this.
customer_reviews.author: MsManager

customer_reviews.title: Perfecto
customer_reviews.text: Platronics legend is kicking ass and taking names in my book Super versatile design...can first both ears Flexible, durable Super fast Bluetooth connection Can detect when I put on and take off Works for me when bicycling in high wind...stays on head ...cancels wind very well Works also while I'm disc golfing I was worried a little about the size of battery component behind the ear but seems not to be a problem I have glasses and it's a little tight but is ok For the price this is superb
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: James Bond Headset
customer_reviews.text: Literally the best headset that has ever been made. Range is OK - but thats not huge problem. The noise cancelling this headset offers is INCREDIBLE. You can be riding on a motorcycle and not hear the wind on the other end of the line, or if your an elite assassin like James Bond, you can be talking on the phone whilst firing your Waller PPK, un-suppressed of course, and the line would be crystal clear.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Great Product IF You Don't Care About Comfort or Looks
customer_reviews.text: Reports of excellent audio quality on other end. Nice controls. On this end - UNCOMFORTABLE. The device always feels like it is ready to fall off my ear unless I jam in the earbud, which doesn't fit snugly - with one exception: when I force the earbud into my ear, the mic boom MUST swivel AWAY from the cheek. Result? You feel like an idiot with a boom hanging 1 1/2 inches off your face. I can actually SEE the boom in my peripheral vision. Since I don't often use an earpiece, I didn't discover this crappy consequence until too late to return the item. I'm going back to Jawbone Era - the MOST comfortable earpiece I've ever worn....
customer_reviews.author: MikeM

product_meta.title: Plantronics Voyager Legend Wireless Bluetooth Headset - Compatible with iPhone, Android, and Other Leading Smartphones - Black
product_meta.description:
Product Packaging:Standard Packaging

Plantronics Voyager Legend is the newest headset in the Voyager family to deliver unsurpassed audio clarity and all‐day comfort. Combining triple‐mics that cancel noise and wind, voice commands, and Smart Sensor technology, Voyager Legend understands how and when you want to talk. Sensors react when you put the headset on, letting you quickly take a call without a click. If you’re already wearing it, Voyager Legend announces who’s calling and waits for you to say "answer" or "ignore." Simply tap the voice command button and ask to check battery level, connection status, and more. With technology this nimble, Legend is the first truly intelligent Bluetooth headset.

Find MyHeadset Andriod App
There are two ways to find your misplaced Plantronics headset.

Send a Note: If you think your headset is powered on and within 33ft/10m of your phone, play a sound file through your headset and hear it signal where it is.

Track It: If you think your headset is powered off or too far away, review its recent activity on a time - stamped map to discover where your headset was last used. (Your GPS location services on your phone must be enabled)

Bonus: If you have the latest Android OS 3.0 or later you will receive an on-screen headset battery meter in the notification bar.
feature_bullets: BLUETOOTH 3.0 HEADSET: Signature Plantronics audio technology and enhanced voice clarity through Bluetooth 3.0 and wideband audio support. compatible with bluetooth 4.0 headsets

SMART SENSOR TECHNOLOGY: Our technology senses when the headset is being worn so it can automatically answer calls as you place the headset on your ear or redirect audio to your phone when you set down your headset

VOICE RECOGNITION: Manage calls hands free without pressing buttons through Plantronics voice recognition technology, just say Answer or Ignore.Operating + storage temp : 32 degree F to 104 degree F (0 to 40 degree C)

NOISE CANCELLING TECHNOLOGY: Our triple mic technology cancels background noise and wind and can separate your voice from 80 dB's of background noise. Charge connector : Proprietary snap fit magnetic connection

WATER RESISTANT: P2i nano coating technology will protect this Bluetooth headset from rain, sweat, and coffee spills so you can wear the headset in the office or at the gym; Please Note: Kindly refer the User manual and the Guide before use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars14,238 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
